text: Scaphitidae is a family of extinct cephalopods belonging to the family of heteromorph ammonites (suborder Ancyloceratina). There is a possible fossil record of them being the last ammonites with a fossil dating to the Danian of the Paleocene in Turkmenistan. ==Genera== Scaphitidae Gill, 1871 *Subfamily Otoscaphitinae Wright, 1953 **Yezoites Yabe, 1910 *Subfamily Scaphitinae Gill, 1871 **Acanthoscaphites Nowak, 1911 **Clioscaphites Cobban, 1951 **Discoscaphites Meek, 1870 **Eoscaphites Breistroffer, 1947 **Hoploscaphites Nowak, 1911 **Indoscaphites Spath, 1953 **Jeletzkytes Riccardi, 1983 **Ponteixites Warren, 1934 **Rhaeboceras Meek, 1876 **Scaphites Parkinson, 1811 **Trachyscaphites Cobban & Scott, 1964 *Subfamily Incertae sedis **Worthoceras Adkins, 1928Paleobiology Database ==References== Category:Ammonitida families
title: Scaphitidae
